original_definition: 'mains' means the electricity supply from the grid of 230 (±10 %) volts of alternating current at 50 Hz;
generated_definition: 'mains' means the electrical power supply to a household appliance, such as a washing machine or washer-dryer, that is connected to the home's electrical grid and provides power for the appliance to function.

Article 1: battery-operatedhousehold washing machines and battery-operatedhousehold washer-dryers that can be connected to themains through an AC/DC converter purchased separately;
battery-operated household washing machines and battery-operated household washer-dryers that can be connected to the mains through an AC/DC converter purchased separately;
Article 2: ‘mains’ or ‘electric mains’ means the electricity supply from the grid of 230 (±10 %) volts of alternating current at 50 Hz;
